para: This option analyzes a track and automatically creates new track segments when it detects an abnormally large gap between points.

This is useful for cleaning up tracks where the GPS signal may have been lost temporarily, causing a large, artificial jump between two points. The filter uses a weighted moving average of the distance between points to determine what constitutes an "abnormal" gap. When such a gap is found, it marks the beginning of a new track segment.
This option also performs a "denoising" step, removing series of redundant points that are extremely close together and have similar properties.

example.title: Automatically segment a track based on gaps

para.userinput: gpsbabel -i gpx -f my_track_with_gps.gpx -x track,segment -o gpx -F segmented_track.gpx
